message.content:
<<<api>>>: JsonElement.getAsString
<<<code>>>: JSONObject resultsObject = jsonObject.getJSONObject("results");
JSONArray resultsArray = resultsObject.getJSONArray("results");
for (int i = 0; i < resultsArray.length(); i++) {
    JSONObject resultObject = resultsArray.getJSONObject(i);
    resultParams[i].confidence = resultObject.getDouble("confidence");
    JSONObject faceObject = resultObject.getJSONObject("face");
    resultParams[i].thumbnail = faceObject.getString("thumbnail");
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue is that you are trying to access the "confidence" field directly from the "results" array, but it is actually nested inside each "result" object. Similarly, the "thumbnail" field is nested inside the "face" object. You need to first get the "results" array, then iterate over each "result" object, and finally access the desired fields from the nested objects.
